summary.p: 4th Kāṇṭam of Ñāṉōpatēcam of Roberto de Nobili.
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (April 2021).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

decoNote.desc: Royal cypher L alternating with decorative design on the spine.

additions.desc: Title, that is, intertitle erroneously taken as title of the work, in Roman transcription, printed in golden letters on the spine: SILIVAIYIN MANTIRATOUKKOU VIVEKAM
BnF shelfmark sticker INDIEN 483 (front cover, verso).
BnF shelfmark Tamoul N°483 written in black pencil (f[1]r).
Running title on top of pages: ñāṉayupatēcam on verso, nālāṅ kāṇṭam on recto.

binding.p: Leather (brown). With title and monogram on spine.

origin.origDate: Internally dated to 1729. See colophon (U1, f206v15). Dated to circa 1750 Vinson in Vinson et al. (1866-) and to 1750 by Cabaton (1912), on unstated grounds (presumably palaeographical and material analysis arguments).

acquisition.p: Probably received from the Jesuits of Pondicherry in 1729 or 1730. See BnF Indien 459-460 for the first 3 Kāṇṭams of Ñāṉōpatēcam.

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine. 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 68, no. 483.
Vinson, Julien & Feer, Léon & s.n. 1866-. Catalogue des manuscrits tamoul et télinga. Manuscript, BnF Indien 577. — See f. 110r, no. 483.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.
